intro: Selepsion, commonly known as the marsh woundwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It typically grows in wet or damp environments such as marshes, stream banks, and wet meadows. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers clustered in spikes. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Selepsion is characterized by its ability to thrive in waterlogged soils and its distinctive floral structure.
